author: pieterastra
content:
This has been said often, but how would you convince those large staking providers to do so?
Ideally they wouldn't need convincing, but choose to do so out of rational self-interest.
Game theoretically, I think this might point to the threat of no bailouts for a majority client mass slashing not being credible enough.
i.e. option 1 -> provider does 'the right thing' and moves to a minority client = certainty of no bailout for client mass slashing
option 2 -> provider stays with the majority client = chance of bailout for mass client slashing because of disruptiveness to the entire ecosystem.

author: okyne
content: DVs are still very new and not production ready yet imo. Block production in DVs is a tricky question because you have MEV extraction on the table as an externality that can compromise stable DV operation. The current plan with Obol is to leverage flashbots' blind block production architecture, such that no entity in the DV knows what they are proposing.
